kw.msg: @{resp_json} = [ {u'name': u'Patch Policy Foo', u'schedule_time': u'01:00', u'schedule_days': 254, u'organization_id': 1, u'create_time': u'2017-01-02 01:47:06.774433', u'notes': u'Notes blah', u'policy_type_name': ...

kw.name: Policy List Should Contain Policy Details
kw.msg:
Policy Details found in Policy List: {u'name': u'api-custom-policy-01', u'schedule_time': u'14:10', u'schedule_days': 254, u'organization_id': 1, u'create_time': u'2017-01-19 07:19:56.391143', u'notes': u'This is api-custom-policy-01', u'policy_type_name': u'custom', u'configuration': {u'test_code': u'#!\/bin\/bash\n\n#Example Test Script for installing chrome on Linux machines\n#This script has been tested with Fedora 24 and Ubuntu 16.04.01 LTS\n#This script may not work on all systems. Modify to fit your needs\n\nfunction Test_Chrome() {\n\tcat \/etc\/*release* | grep -E '(Fedora|Red Hat)' >& \/dev\/null\n\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\t\trpm -qa | grep \"google-chrome-stable\" >& \/dev\/null\n\t\t\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome script has detected Chrome.\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 0 #package is installed\n\t\t\telse\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome Script failed! Remediation scipt needs to run\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 1 #package is not installed\n\t\t\tfi\n\n\tfi\n\n\tcat \/etc\/*release* | grep -E '(Ubuntu|Debian)' &> \/dev\/null\n\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\tdpkg -l | grep \"google-chrome-stable\" >& \/dev\/null\n\t\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome script has detected Chrome.\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 0\n\t\t\telse\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome Script failed! Remediation scipt needs to run\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 1\n\t\t\tfi\n\tfi\n}\nTest_Chrome\nexit $?\n
', u'os_family': u'Linux', u'evaluation_code': u'#!\/bin\/bash\n\n#Example Test Script for installing chrome on Linux machines\n#This script has been tested with Fedora 24 and Ubuntu 16.04.01 LTS\n#This script may not work on all systems. Modify to fit your needs\n\nfunction Test_Chrome() {\n\tcat \/etc\/*release* | grep -E '(Fedora|Red Hat)' >& \/dev\/null\n\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\t\trpm -qa | grep \"google-chrome-stable\" >& \/dev\/null\n\t\t\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome script has detected Chrome.\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 0 #package is installed\n\t\t\telse\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome Script failed! Remediation scipt needs to run\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 1 #package is not installed\n\t\t\tfi\n\n\tfi\n\n\tcat \/etc\/*release* | grep -E '(Ubuntu|Debian)' &> \/dev\/null\n\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\tdpkg -l | grep \"google-chrome-stable\" >& \/dev\/null\n\t\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome script has detected Chrome.\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 0\n\t\t\telse\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome Script failed! Remediation scipt needs to run\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 1\n\t\t\tfi\n\tfi\n}\nTest_Chrome\nexit $?\n
', u'remediation_code': u'#!\/bin\/bash\n\n#Example Remediation Script for installing chrome on Linux machines\n#This script has been tested with Fedora 24 and Ubuntu 16.04.01 LTS\n#This script may not work on all systems. Modify to fit your needs\n\ncat \/etc\/*release* | grep -E '(Fedora|Red Hat)' >& \/dev\/null\nif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n#Add Chrome Repo:\necho \"[google-chrome]\nname=google-chrome - \\$basearch\nbaseurl=http:\/\/dl.google.com\/linux\/chrome\/rpm\/stable\/\\$basearch\nenabled=1\ngpgcheck=1\ngpgkey=https:\/\/dl-ssl.google.com\/linux\/linux_signing_key.pub\" > \/etc\/yum.repos.d\/google-chrome.repo\n#Install Chrome:\nyum install google-chrome-stable -y &> \/dev\/null\nfi\n\ncat \/etc\/*release* | grep -E '(Ubuntu|Debian)' >& \/dev\/null\nif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\techo \"deb http:\/\/dl.google.com\/linux\/chrome\/deb\/ stable main\" >> \/etc\/apt\/sources.list.d\n\twget -q -O - https:\/\/dl-ssl.google.com\/linux\/linux_signing_key.pub | apt-key add -\n\tapt-get update\n\tapt-get install google-chrome-stable -y &> \/dev\/null\nfi\n
'}, u'id': 103}

Modify to fit your needs\n\nfunction Test_Chrome() {\n\tcat \/etc\/*release* | grep -E '(Fedora|Red Hat)' >& \/dev\/null\n\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\t\trpm -qa | grep \"google-chrome-stable\" >& \/dev\/null\n\t\t\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome script has detected Chrome.\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 0 #package is installed\n\t\t\telse\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome Script failed! Remediation scipt needs to run\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 1 #package is not installed\n\t\t\tfi\n\n\tfi\n\n\tcat \/etc\/*release* | grep -E '(Ubuntu|Debian)' &> \/dev\/null\n\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\tdpkg -l | grep \"google-chrome-stable\" >& \/dev\/null\n\t\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome script has detected Chrome.\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 0\n\t\t\telse\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome Script failed! Remediation scipt needs to run\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 1\n\t\t\tfi\n\tfi\n}\nTest_Chrome\nexit $?\n
', u'os_family': u'Linux', u'evaluation_code': u'#!\/bin\/bash\n\n#Example Test Script for installing chrome on Linux machines\n#This script has been tested with Fedora 24 and Ubuntu 16.04.01 LTS\n#This script may not work on all systems. Modify to fit your needs\n\nfunction Test_Chrome() {\n\tcat \/etc\/*release* | grep -E '(Fedora|Red Hat)' >& \/dev\/null\n\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\t\trpm -qa | grep \"google-chrome-stable\" >& \/dev\/null\n\t\t\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome script has detected Chrome.\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 0 #package is installed\n\t\t\telse\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome Script failed! Remediation scipt needs to run\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 1 #package is not installed\n\t\t\tfi\n\n\tfi\n\n\tcat \/etc\/*release* | grep -E '(Ubuntu|Debian)' &> \/dev\/null\n\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\tdpkg -l | grep \"google-chrome-stable\" >& \/dev\/null\n\t\tif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome script has detected Chrome.\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 0\n\t\t\telse\n\t\t\t\techo \"Test_Chrome Script failed! Remediation scipt needs to run\" 1>&2\n\t\t\t\treturn 1\n\t\t\tfi\n\tfi\n}\nTest_Chrome\nexit $?\n
', u'remediation_code': u'#!\/bin\/bash\n\n#Example Remediation Script for installing chrome on Linux machines\n#This script has been tested with Fedora 24 and Ubuntu 16.04.01 LTS\n#This script may not work on all systems. Modify to fit your needs\n\ncat \/etc\/*release* | grep -E '(Fedora|Red Hat)' >& \/dev\/null\nif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n#Add Chrome Repo:\necho \"[google-chrome]\nname=google-chrome - \\$basearch\nbaseurl=http:\/\/dl.google.com\/linux\/chrome\/rpm\/stable\/\\$basearch\nenabled=1\ngpgcheck=1\ngpgkey=https:\/\/dl-ssl.google.com\/linux\/linux_signing_key.pub\" > \/etc\/yum.repos.d\/google-chrome.repo\n#Install Chrome:\nyum install google-chrome-stable -y &> \/dev\/null\nfi\n\ncat \/etc\/*release* | grep -E '(Ubuntu|Debian)' >& \/dev\/null\nif [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then\n\techo \"deb http:\/\/dl.google.com\/linux\/chrome\/deb\/ stable main\" >> \/etc\/apt\/sources.list.d\n\twget -q -O - https:\/\/dl-ssl.google.com\/linux\/linux_signing_key.pub | apt-key add -\n\tapt-get update\n\tapt-get install google-chrome-stable -y &> \/dev\/null\nfi\n

kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with the given arguments and ignores possible error.

kw.name: Get Request
kw.doc: Send a GET request on the session object found using the
kw.msg: Get Request using : alias=automoxapi, uri=/servergroups, headers=None

kw.name: Set Variable
kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.name: Get Group Id
kw.msg: Group Name not found in Group List: [{u'name': u'', u'policy_set_id': 1, u'parent_server_group_id': 1, u'override': True, u'id': 1, u'refresh_interval': 1440}]

kw.name: Log
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.

kw.name: Convert To Integer
kw.doc: Converts the given item to an integer number.
kw.msg: 'None' cannot be converted to an integer: TypeError: int() argument must be a string or a number, not 'NoneType'

kw.name: Create Dictionary
kw.doc: Creates and returns a dictionary based on the given ``items``.
